weka.clusterers

Class DBACluster.AntHill.Ant

  • java.lang.Object
    • weka.clusterers.DBACluster.AntHill.Ant
  • Enclosing class:
    DBACluster.AntHill

    protected class DBACluster.AntHill.Ant
extends java.lang.Object
    Ants (agents) that perform the clustering task.

    Ants walk over the DBACluster.AntHill.InstancePlaceholder objects and also calculate their neighbors, local similarity values and assign DBACluster.AntHill.Clusters to them.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      protected class  DBACluster.AntHill.Ant.InstancePlaceholderNeighborTagDistanceComparator
      Compares two neighborhood relations by their distance.

        protected double foiNoiseThreshold
        All instances with a calculated local similarity value belwow this threshold are regarded as noise DBACluster.AntHill.InstancePlaceholders by this ant.

      • autoShutdownAfterNumIdleCalls

        protected int autoShutdownAfterNumIdleCalls
        If the ant could not work for this amount of calls in series, because it walked on a already clustered DBACluster.AntHill.InstancePlaceholder, it assumes the clustering task is done and shuts down.

      • idleCalls

        protected int idleCalls
        How many times the ant was on a already clustered DBACluster.AntHill.InstancePlaceholder in series. Once the ant finds a InstancePlaceholder, that is not clustered this value resets to 0.

      • isActive

        protected boolean isActive
        Indicate whether this ant is active or shut down.

      • remember

        private DBACluster.AntHill.InstancePlaceholder remember
        The remembered DBACluster.AntHill.InstancePlaceholder of this ant.

        Ants can only remember InstancePlaceholder objects and relate to them like this, but not pick them up and carry them around, because they walk in the same space where the Instance objects are located and every picking and dropping action would alter the Instances. Picking Instance objects up would mean to remove them temporarily from Instances and dropping would mean to change their attributes in order to relocate them in the space. Of course this is not acceptable. This value corresponds to a carry capacity of an ant.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Ant

        public Ant(DBACluster.AntHill antHill,
           double viewRange,
           double foiRaiseTolerance,
           double foiNoiseThreshold,
           int autoShutdownAfterNumIdleCalls)
        The default constructor of this class.
        Parameters:
        antHill - DBACluster.AntHill that manages this ant
        viewRange - relative view range distance for this ant
        foiRaiseTolerance - tolerance of this ant for a raise of the local similarity between two InstancePlaceholder objects.
        foiNoiseThreshold - threshold for recognizing InstancePlaceholder objects as noise. Set to -1 to not seek for noise InstancePlaceholder objects.
        autoShutdownAfterNumIdleCalls - after how many steps on clustered InstancePlaceholder objects in series this ant has to shut down. If no valid value is given it defaults to 100.
        See Also:
        antHill, viewRange, foiRaiseTolerance, foiNoiseThreshold, autoShutdownAfterNumIdleCalls

    • Method Detail

      • isActive

        public boolean isActive()
        Tells if this ant is active.
        Returns:
        true, if this ant is active, false if not, e.g. it was shut down.

      • call

        public void call()
        Calls this ant to do something (to work and to walk).

      • work

        protected void work()
        Clusters DBACluster.AntHill.InstancePlaceholder objects. If the neighbors are not known or the local similarity is not calculated for this or any neighbor InstancePlaceholder this task is done at first. Only if any of these tasks is already done and the environment of the current InstancePlaceholder is explored, the clustering task can start. If the local similarity does not differ more than foiRaiseTolerance from a close cluster, clusters must be merged.

      • walk

        protected void walk()
        Moves the ant to another GridInstance.

        The walk direction depends on 3 factors:

        • if the ant has a destination it goes there
        • if the ant holds an DBACluster.AntHill.InstancePlaceholder it searches for clusters and stops when reaching one or could not find any in a dense environment
        • if the ant does not hold an InstancePlaceholder it walks randomly.
        See Also:
        destination, holdsInstancePlaceholder()

      • changeCluster

        protected void changeCluster(DBACluster.AntHill.Cluster from,
                             DBACluster.AntHill.Cluster to)
        Direct the ant to merge two DBACluster.AntHill.Clusters into one.

        In this implementation the ant receives information from the cluster about its members. When the ant explores the environment itself, it runs slower, but with less information. In another implementation the ant could check all neighbors from a starting DBACluster.AntHill.InstancePlaceholder for example, and add them to a internal todo list if they have the cluster from. Then change the cluster and do like this with the other InstancePlaceholder objects on the todo list.

        Parameters:
        from - the starting cluster to be merged into to. It dissolves in the changeCluster process and its InstancePlaceholder members are moved to the cluster to.
        to - the target cluster to which the cluster from is merged.

      • testExplorePosition

        protected DBACluster.AntHill.InstancePlaceholder testExplorePosition(DBACluster.AntHill.InstancePlaceholder position)
        Tells the next DBACluster.AntHill.InstancePlaceholder position that should be explored before clustering the current position position. So the returned InstancePlaceholder can be prioritized over position.
        Parameters:
        position -
        Returns:
        the InstancePlaceholder that should be processed before position or null if there is no InstancePlaceholder to explore with higher priority.

      • holdsInstancePlaceholder

        public final boolean holdsInstancePlaceholder()
        Tells if this ant is linked to a DBACluster.AntHill.InstancePlaceholder, if it is remembering one (as if carrying it).
        Returns:
        true, if the ant remembers an InstancePlaceholder, false otherwise.

      • getRememberedInstancePlaceholder

        public final DBACluster.AntHill.InstancePlaceholder getRememberedInstancePlaceholder()
        Tells the DBACluster.AntHill.InstancePlaceholder this ant remembers at the moment.
        Returns:
        the InstancePlaceholder this ant remembers or null if the ant does not remember a InstancePlaceholder at the moment.

      • take

        protected final boolean take(DBACluster.AntHill.InstancePlaceholder ip)
        Remembers another DBACluster.AntHill.InstancePlaceholder as if the ant would pick it up. It releases any previously hold InstancePlaceholder.
        Parameters:
        ip - the InstancePlaceholder the ant should remember now
        Returns:
        true on success, false otherwise.

      • release

        protected final boolean release()
        Direct the ant to forget an DBACluster.AntHill.InstancePlaceholder it possibly remembers.
        Returns:
        true, if the ant does not remember an InstancePlaceholder right now, no matter if it successfully forgot an InstancePlaceholder it remembered before or did not remember a InstancePlaceholder before. False on failure.
